alert.note: Alert for Owsley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 7:55PM EST until February 18 at 2:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following river in Kentucky... South Fork Kentucky River at Booneville affecting Owsley County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Fork Kentucky River at Booneville. * WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM EST Friday the stage was 32.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM EST Friday was 32.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage by early Saturday afternoon and continue falling to 6.7 feet early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 32.5 feet on 03/07/1989. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. The next statement will be issued by Midnight tonight.
